formattedAddress: Lower Level, 169 W 78th St, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: Lower Level, 169 W 78th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text:
I couldn't be happier!! In just the couple of months I've been working with Fred (just one session per week!), I've already lost fat, gained muscle, and felt stronger and more confident. He is kind, gentle, and encouraging but also pushes me always to do my best and work my hardest. In addition, I'm a person who always gets injured when I exercise, but no longer! Fred is so careful and cautious in his training that I've never even felt a strain from my workouts. It's almost like physical therapy in many ways!

Re: COVID safety concerns: This gym is different than most gyms where you hire a personal trainer because at SlowBurn, you and your trainer are the only ones in the gym (vs being in a gyms with tons of people).

I highly recommend trying a session if you're ready for something new that works.

originalText.text: I have been training in slow burn at Fred’s studio for the past 4 years. Fred has created a scientific body building technique which is highly efficient, injury free, requiring no more than 30 minutes one or two times a week, allowing the body to both fatigue and recover according to its natural rhythm. The studio is kept spotlessly clean, the trainers follow Fred’s method meticulously and maintain a log of their client’s progress on each machine so it is clear how one is building strength over months and years.

originalText.text: I've been doing super-slow HIT (High Intensity Training) for the past 20 years and at 60 I am injury-free, stronger and leaner than when I was 30. I had read Fred Hahn's book, and on a recent trip to NYC booked in for a workout. I thought I was an expert but Fred and his team take training to a higher level, with equipment even upgraded to better match the human strength curve and loads of nuances in the way they program clients. I really felt the difference and especially confident that I was in good hands. Finally, it's obvious that they go the extra mile in integrating effective nutritional advice with great training advice = better results with less time in the gym. It's also small which I like, as you get the attention you need and feel at home. This is not the gym for those wanting to go do their own thing. Fred would not allow that. It's for people who want a great training outcome from cutting edge training delivered by trainers who understand quality training.

originalText.text: I’ve trained with Fred for many years because his slow-burn program works. My weekly 30-minute training sessions have helped me remain in excellent physical shape as I’ve gotten older, an age-defying physicality that my friends often comment on. And I love the fact that at Serious Strength, failure (i.e. muscular fatigue) equals success (i.e. muscular improvement). It is the only thing I’ve ever done in my life where I’m focused on achieving consistent failure.

originalText.text: This is the best experience in my life exercising. While it is hard, it is not very long, so I can handle it. It is very efficient. For me, along with getting stronger, I also completely normalize my cholesterol. The studio is put together with love and everybody is just a delight. And it is perfect for our busy modern life. You can get in and out in your business day, you will not need to shower....on top of that, you will get lots of advice andvrespurces on health, eating, well being. Go for it, guys.
